headline.main: The Health of Hon. W. R. King.
Finances of the City-Estimated Expenditures for 1853

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Board of Aldermen, on Tuesday evening, a communication was received from the Controller, with a detailed estimate of the receipts and expenditures of the City Government, for the year 1853, and also an estimate of the probable amount of tax that may be required for the said year.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Biography of Robert Bruce. That " KINGS never die," is not only a legal dogma, but is an historical truth. Their deeds follow them. Like ELIJAH, they throw the mantle of their spirit upon others.
docs.snippet: A Biography of Robert Bruce. That " KINGS never die," is not only a legal dogma, but is an historical truth. Their deeds follow them. Like ELIJAH, they throw the mantle of their spirit upon others.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the London Times. Dispatches and private letters have just arrived at the Foreign Office and the Prussian Embassy from the expedition is the interior of Africa, conducted by BARTH and OVERWEG At the request of his Excellency Chevalier BUNSEN, I beg to submit to you a few particulars of the progress of that expedition, which may interest some of your readers.
docs.abstract: Expedition of Dr. Barth to Central africa

docs.lead_paragraph: The Sixteenth Anniversary of the Association for the Benefit of Colored Orphans was held in the Asylum, corner of Forty-third-street and Fifth-avenue, on Monday morning. This Institution, which now exercises a wide and beneficent influence, originated in the philanthropic efforts of two ladies, members of the Society of Friends--the present Secretary and Treasurer--who, visiting the haunts of the miserable colored outcasts, felt strongly that justice, humanity and safety demanded something should be done for them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ex-Senator BENTON said recently in conversation with a gentleman who spoke of his being the last of the group, "CLAY, WEBSTER and CALHOUN are gone; years ago Dr.---told me, 'When these men are dead, you will be fresh and vigorous as ever.' My habits of living do it; until I was thirty, I drank nothing, Sir! Since then I have drank only what circumstances made it fit I; should drink.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: From the London Spectator. Occasionally the Police make vigorous attacks on the squalid parts of great towns, drag forth the wretched abiders in such places, and arraign them under some sanitary act of Parliament for offences against health or decency. In a raid of that sort, several Irish people were summoned before Mr. YARDLEY, from Slater's Court.
